citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
There were several expired medications in the refrigerator and cupboards in the hospital area. These were expired short
term such as June of 2021 as well as much older going back to 2017 and 2019. These medications need to be gone
through and properly disposed of. If the attending veterinarian feels that they are still appropriate for use then she will
need to re-label them with new expiration dates and sign off on the use of the medication(s).
Correct by: 10-30-2021

citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
The records of acquisition, disposition, inventory, and veterinary care were unavailable at time of the inspection. Staff
was unsure as to where the records were being kept and unable to locate them for the inspection. The inspector must be
able to examine records required to be kept by the Act and the regulations in this part.
Correct by: 10-29-2021

The wood resting platform in the cougar enclosure is in disrepair. The wood on top is so clawed/chewed that holes exist.
Wood splinters pose a risk of injury to the animal as well as possible ingestion of the material. Outdoor housing facilities
shall be structurally sound and shall be maintained in good repair. This platform needs to be repaired, replaced or
removed from the enclosure.
Correct by: 10-02-2021

There were 5 light fixtures in the food prep area but three of the five were not working at time of the inspection. Lighting
shall be uniformly distributed and of sufficient intensity to permit routine inspection and cleaning. Reliable and adequate
electric power, if required to comply with other provisions of this subpart.
Correct by: 10-07-2021

The walk-in cooler had a strong odor of spoilage. The floor was wet and broken. Water was filling in under the flooring
and odors and food waste could be trapped under it. This flooring could also allow vermin in. The vent covering was
rusted and water was dripping from the ceiling. Supplies of food shall be stored in facilities which adequately protect
such supplies against deterioration, molding, or contamination by vermin. Refrigeration shall be provided for supplies of
perishable food. This flooring needs to be repaired or replaced to prevent the water and food waste from becoming
trapped underneath and to discourage vermin from entering. Repairs need to be addressed to prevent water from
dripping into the food. The vent needs to be replaced so that it can be cleaned properly.
Correct by: 10-29-2021

The two metal water bowls used for the fishing cats were green with algae. These bowls were setting in the full sun so
the water is not staying cool. If the water is not palatable the animals won't drink enough for optimal health. All water
receptacles shall be kept clean and sanitary.
Correct by: 09-30-2021

In the caracal enclosure there were old white feces stuck in the right front corner between the enclosure chain mesh and
the resting platform. Feces need to be removed as they can attract vermin and insects to the animal which are disease
hazards. Excreta shall be removed from primary enclosures as often as necessary to prevent contamination of the
animals contained therein and to minimize disease hazards and to reduce odors. This needs to be removed and cleaned
properly.
Correct by: 10-01-2021
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
End Section

narrative:
2.40(a)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
There were several expired medications in the refrigerator and cupboards in the hospital area.  These were expired short 
term such as June of 2021 as well as much older going back to 2017 and 2019.  These medications need to be gone 
through and properly disposed of.  If the attending veterinarian feels that they are still appropriate for use then she will 
need to re-label them with new expiration dates and sign off on the use of the medication(s). 
 
Correct by:  10-30-2021 
2.126 
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
The records of acquisition, disposition, inventory, and veterinary care were unavailable at time of the inspection.  Staff 
was unsure as to where the records were being kept and unable to locate them for the inspection.   The inspector must be 
able to examine records required to be kept by the Act and the regulations in this part. 
 
Correct by:  10-29-2021 
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general.

The wood resting platform in the cougar enclosure is in disrepair.  The wood on top is so clawed/chewed that holes exist.  
Wood splinters pose a risk of injury to the animal as well as possible ingestion of the material.  Outdoor housing facilities 
shall be structurally sound and shall be maintained in good repair.  This platform needs to be repaired, replaced or 
removed from the enclosure. 
 
Correct by:  10-02-2021 
3.125(b) 
   
Facilities, general. 
There were 5 light fixtures in the food prep area but three of the five were not working at time of the inspection.  Lighting 
shall be uniformly distributed and of sufficient intensity to permit routine inspection and cleaning.  Reliable and adequate 
electric power, if required to comply with other provisions of this subpart. 
 
Correct by:  10-07-2021 
3.125(c) 
   
Facilities, general. 
The walk-in cooler had a strong odor of spoilage.  The floor was wet and broken.  Water was filling in under the flooring 
and odors and food waste could be trapped under it.  This flooring could also allow vermin in.  The vent covering was 
rusted and water was dripping from the ceiling.   Supplies of food shall be stored in facilities which adequately protect 
such supplies against deterioration, molding, or contamination by vermin. Refrigeration shall be provided for supplies of 
perishable food.  This flooring needs to be repaired or replaced to prevent the water and food waste from becoming 
trapped underneath and to discourage vermin from entering.  Repairs need to be addressed to prevent water from 
dripping into the food.  The vent needs to be replaced so that it can be cleaned properly.

Correct by:  10-29-2021 
3.130 
   
Watering. 
The two metal water bowls used for the fishing cats were green with algae.  These bowls were setting in the full sun so 
the water is not staying cool.  If the water is not palatable the animals won't drink enough for optimal health.   All water 
receptacles shall be kept clean and sanitary. 
 
Correct by:  09-30-2021 
3.131 
   
Sanitation. 
In the caracal enclosure there were old white feces stuck in the right front corner between the enclosure chain mesh and 
the resting platform. Feces need to be removed as they can attract vermin and insects to the animal which are disease 
hazards.  Excreta shall be removed from primary enclosures as often as necessary to prevent contamination of the 
animals contained therein and to minimize disease hazards and to reduce odors.  This needs to be removed and cleaned 
properly. 
 
Correct by:  10-01-2021 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative. 
 
End Section
